info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Newton and east central Jasper Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Call, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kirbyville, Call, Trout Creek, Old Salem and Bleakwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
